results.title: Lo-Arna 1981
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Nottage, Bob Weis, Channel 0\28 and Generation Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Women of the sun (A)”.
Part Four of the “Women of the Sun” series which presents events that occurred to four different aboriginal women, at different periods in time. This episode is set in 1981 and examines the inner turmoil and insecurity of an 18 year old girl when her adoptive parents tell her she is not of French Polynesian descent, but is the daughter of an Aboriginal woman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoffrey Nottage, Bob Weis, Channel 0\28 and Generation Films

results.title: Nerida Anderson, 1939
results.creator_credit: Stephen Wallace, Bob Weis, Channel 0\28 and Generation Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Women of the sun (A)”.
Part Three of a series which presents events that occurred to four different aboriginal women at different periods in time. Set in 1939, this episode examines attempts by Nerida Anderson and her family to improve conditions on the Aboriginal Reserve where they live. Such attempts and displays of independence outrage the manager. He has Nerida and her family tried for treason. Realising a no-win situation, the entire population of the reserve pack their belongings and leave.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Stephen Wallace, Bob Weis, Channel 0\28 and Generation Films

results.title: Maydina the shadow 1890's
results.creator_credit: David Stevens, Bob Weis, Channel 0\28 and Generation Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Women of the sun (A)”.
Part Two of a series which presents events that occurred to four different aboriginal women at different periods in time. This episode examines the life of Maydina and her daughter on a church mission run by a self-appointed guardian at the turn of the century. Follows her struggle to return to a tribal existence and her efforts to prevent her daughter being taken away from her by the mission guardian.

results.title: The Bedspread
results.creator_credit: Natalie Green, Elizabeth O'Neill and Berry St Film Productions
results.brief_description: Concerns two poverty-stricken women, Mrs Clancy and Mrs Parsons, living in Melbourne during the depression. Mrs Clancy owns a good bedspread, her pride and joy. Mrs Parsons asks to borrow the bedspread in preparation for a visit by a specialist to her sick daughter. This small incident becomes the focal point of the day. Cast includes Janet Robertson, Moira Claux and Kim Deacon. Based on a short story by Iris Simmons.

results.title: Fingers of gold
results.creator_credit: Banana Growers Federation and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: Illustrates banana production and distribution in New South Wales. Provides information on such aspects as irrigation, protection from the cold, pests and fungus, harvesting, packing and controlled ripening.

results.title: The Siege of Barton's bathroom
results.brief_description: Elly Barton lives in a barren suburban housing estate where there is only one tree left standing. Now the neighbours want to cut it down, but what no-one seems to understand is that it is Elly’s tree - and she is not going to let anybody touch it. Stars Frankie J. Holden, Max Phipps and Rebekah Elmaloglou.

results.title: Listen to a city
results.creator_credit: Eric Fullilove, Andrew J. Helgeson and Cinesound
results.brief_description: A sophisticated view of Melbourne taking in its gardens, shops, theatres, restaurants, nightclubs and discotheques. Sporting activities include a race meeting, a football match, and water sports. Highlights Melbourne’s annual Moombe Festival and includes scenes at Montsalvat.

results.title: From little things big things grow: Kev Carmody, singer
results.creator_credit: Trevor Graham, Rachel Perkins, Ned Lander and City Pictures
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Blood brothers (A)”.
Interspersed with video clips from his protest album “Pillars of society” Kev Carmody talks about his life and music. Born in Goronba, Queensland, on a cattle station, the son of an Irish stockman and his Aboriginal wife, Carmody spent his early years living off the land, but absorbing western culture through the ABC and old records. Taken away from his parents at the age of ten, he was put in a Christian school and sent home twice a year. After several years working at various menial jobs, whilst developing his music he eventually gained a Ph.D in Australian history, using oral material and methods rather than a written thesis. A fascinating portrait of a committed man.

results.title: Three in one
results.creator_credit: Cecil Holmes and Australian Tradition Films
results.brief_description: A trilogy of Australian stories about mateship. “Joe Wilson’s Mates”, from a story by Henry Lawson, is set in the 1890’s and is about a stranger in town who dies alone, but is given a funeral because he carries a Union Card. “The Load of Wood”, from a story by Frank Hardy, is set during the depression of the 1930’s. “The City”, is a love story set in Sydney in the 1950’s. The three stories are linked by introductory comments from John McCallum, who also narrates them. Cast includes Leonard Teale, Edmund Allison, Jock Levy, Joan Landor, Brian Vicery, Reg Lye.
